intro: Turraea boivinii, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a fruit that resembles a starfruit, though it is not related to the common starfruit (Carambola). It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Turraea boivinii is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
